svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9100 i and 9200 iDAY CAB MODELS after march 1997

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 112 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 9100 i and 9200 i day cab models after March 1997 contains one air spring (bag) (Item 4), two shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 7). The air suspension assembly (Figure 112) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 13), hex nipple fitting (Item 11), elbow fitting (Item 12), air spring (bag) (Item 4), height control valve (Item 7), shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) and lateral control rod (Item 3) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 7), air spring (bag) (Item 4) and shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 112) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 7, Figure 112) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 113 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Inspect height control valve (Item 3) to insure drive bearing notch (Item 14) is located on "SUPS" port side of valve. If not, loosen pan head bearing screw (Item 13), but not remove, and pull height control valve arm (Item 7) loose from drive bearing (Item 15). Rotate drive bearing until drive bearing notch is in correct position, then secure height control valve arm by tightening pan head bearing screw. Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-in (4.5 to 5.6 N•m).
Position height control valve (Item 3) in place on mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 10).

Install two carriage bolts (Item 8) thru mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 10) and height control valve (Item 3) and install two hex lock nuts (Item 9). Tighten to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).

Install height control valve linkage (Item 5) onto threaded ball pivot (Item 6) of height control valve arm (Item 7) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place, latch the linkage clip.

Push push to connect elbow fitting (Item 1) into "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (supply) (Item 2) into push to connect elbow fitting (Item 1) in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 4) into "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate. Cab air suspension ride height is 5 3/16 inches (131.8 mm) (Figure 174) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9100 i AND 9200 i DAY CAB MODELS AFTER MARCH 1997
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 112 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install shock absorber (Item 5) as follows.

step2.para: Position bottom of shock absorber (Item 5) into mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Install hex head bolt (Item 18) from outboard side thru crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and shock absorber (Item 5) and install hex lock nut (Item 19). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).
Position top of shock absorber (Item 5) into mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install hex head bolt (Item 18) from outboard side thru cab mounting plate (Item 1) and shock absorber (Item 5) and install hex lock nut (Item 19). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).

step1.para: Install shock absorber (Item 6) as follows.

step2.para: Position bottom of shock absorber (Item 6) into mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Install hex head bolt (Item 18) from outboard side thru crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and shock absorber (Item 6) and install hex lock nut (Item 19). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).
Position top of shock absorber (Item 6) into mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install hex head bolt (Item 18) from outboard side thru cab mounting plate (Item 1) and shock absorber (Item 6) and install hex lock nut (Item 19). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 112 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position air spring (bag) (Item 4) in place between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Install machine screw (Item 20) thru crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) into bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 4). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Install hex head bolt (Item 21) with lock washer (Item 22) thru cab mounting plate (Item 1) into top of air spring (bag) (Item 4). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

Install hex nipple fitting (Item 11) into top of air spring (bag) (Item 4). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Install elbow fitting (Item 12) onto hex nipple fitting (Item 11) at top of air spring (bag) (Item 4). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 13) into compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 12) at top of air spring (bag) (Item 4). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate. Cab air suspension ride height is 5 3/16 inches (131.8 mm) (Figure 174) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9100 i AND 9200 i DAY CAB MODELS AFTER MARCH 1997
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 112 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod (Item 3) as follows.

step2.para: Position lateral control rod (Item 3) in mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and install hex head bolt (Item 23) from the back thru mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate and lateral control rod (Item 3) and install hex lock nut (Item 24). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).

Position lateral control rod (Item 3) in mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex head bolt (Item 23) from the back thru mounting bracket of cab mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 24). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).
